Import an existing lexicon.
Export this FieldWorks project to a file.
Back up a FieldWorks project.
Restore a FieldWorks project.
Delete FieldWorks project.
Create a desktop shortcut to this project.
Edit the special properties of this FieldWorks project (such as name and writing systems).
Undo previous actions.
Redo previous actions.

Copy

Break selected phrase into words.

Shows only the basic set of fields.
Show the sidebar.
Show the list of records.
Display the dictionary entry for this lexeme above the Lexicon Edit pane.
Display all possible fields.
Toggle between the baseline and interlinear text view.
Turn off all filters.
View the invisible, zero-width spaces in this text.
Show the first item.
Show the previous item.
Show the next item.
Show the last item.
Merge current lexical entry into another entry.
Approve the suggested analysis and move to the next word.
Approve the suggested analysis throughout this text, and move to the next word.
Approve the suggested analysis, and jump to the next word with a suggested or incomplete analysis.
Approve the suggested analysis and stay on this word
Approve the suggested analysis and move to the next word, to the same interlinear line.
Approve the suggested analysis and move to the word on the right.
Approve the suggested analysis and move to the word on the left,
Leave the suggested analysis as a suggestion, and move to the next word.
Leave the suggested analysis as a suggestion, and jump to the next word with a suggested or incomplete analysis.
Leave the suggested analysis and move to the next word, to the same interlinear line.
Leave the suggested analysis as a suggestion, and move to the word on the right.
Leave the suggested analysis as a suggestion, and move to the word on the left.
Create a new entry and add it to the lexicon.
Create a new lexical entry.
Add a new category.
Create a new annotation definition.
Create a new semantic domain.
Create a new {0}.
Create a new {0}.
Create a new {0}.
Create a new morpheme type.
Create a new {0}.
Insert a new subtype in this type.
Add a Variant Form to this entry
This Lexeme Form contains several morphemes. Add the fields for me to specify the components and type of complex form.
This Lexeme Form is related to another form as a variant. Add the fields for me to specify the related form(s) and type of variant.
This Lexeme Form is also another kind of variant. Add the fields for me to specify the related form(s) and the variant type(s).
Add an allomorph to this entry
Create a new anthropology category.
Create a new location.
Add a new person.
Add a picture to this entry.
Create a new lexical relation.
Create a new headed compound.
Create a new non-headed compound.
Create a new phoneme.
Create a new natural class, defined by listing phonemes.
Create a new natural class, defined by features.
Create a new environment.
Create a new phonological rule.
Create a new metathesis rule.
Create a rule to prevent morphemes from co-occurring.
Create a rule to prevent allomorphs from co-occurring.
Create a group of ad hoc rules.
Import a set of words in a file and give the set a name.
Insert a new sense.
Insert a new subsense.
Insert a link to an external file.
Insert a free translation.
Insert a literal translation.
Insert a note.
Choose texts to display and use.
Add a custom list.
Add an allomorph of a stem.
Add an allomorph of an affix.
Add a pronunciation field to this entry.
Add a sound or movie file to the pronunciation, creating the pronunciation if necessary.
Add a new text to the corpus.
Create a new feature type.
Add a phonological feature.
Add a feature.
Add a complex feature.
Add a subcategory...
Insert a subcategory in this anthropology category.
Insert a subdomain in this semantic domain.
Insert a subitem in this location.
Insert a subitem in this item.
Insert a subitem in this item.
Create a new Record in your Notebook.
Create a Subrecord in your Notebook.
Turn on mode in which a click inserts an invisible, zero-width space.
Have Language Explorer insert invisible, zero-width spaces as word breaks according to the word list and lexical entries.
Add, delete, or change styles.
Add, remove, or change the writing systems specified for this project.
Show the entries and edit them.
See a list of entries with problems.
Configure properties of a list.
Run some special utilities to process your data.
Add or edit custom fields.
Configure current browse pane.
Show dictionary entry for root/stem of current word, or open a search dialog box.
Add the current word to the lexicon (if it is a vernacular word).
Start the Character Map utility.
Add words marked as correctly spelled to the active spelling dictionary.
Bulk Edit Spelling Status.
View incorrectly spelled words in use.
Change spelling of multiple occurrences.
As I add new word glosses, create lexical entries.
Start the Parser running.
Stop the Parser.
Reload the Parser information.
Have the Parser try a single word.
Have the Parser parse just the current word.
Edit the special parameters for the Parser.
Launch a new window of this editor.
If checked, this will show balloon pop-up help for items.
Display version information about this application.
Display a document describing how FieldWorks handles morphology (only available in English).
Display the Language Explorer Student Manual, to learn the basics.
Display the Language Explorer Instructor Guide.
You can edit your Grammar Sketch in XLingPaper format using an XML editor (only available in English).
Display exercises you can follow to practice using Language Explorer.
Help on using Language Explorer (only available in English).
Run the Demo Movies.
Purpose of movies and where else to find help.
Tour of Language Explorer.
Examples of configuring columns.
Examples of filtering.
Examples of using sorting features.
Configuring fields displayed in an Edit pane.
Example of creating a new entry.
Example of finding an entry.

Example of specifying a derivative.
Example of specifying a variant.
Example of using Categorized Entry.
Example of using Bulk Edit List Choice.
Example of using Bulk Edit Bulk Copy.
Example of using Bulk Edit Click Copy.
Example of adding a text and interlinearizing some words.
Example of changing analysis usage.
Example of adding an affix template.
Play all the movies (length 84 minutes).
Display Introduction to Lexicography (only available in English).
Display technical notes on SFM database import (only available in English).
Display technical notes on LinguaLinks database import (only available in English).
Display technical notes on interlinear import (only available in English).
Display technical notes on Writing Systems (only available in English).
A short name for this category.
The abbreviation to be used for this category.
A fuller description of this category.
Information about any inflectional templates of this category.
The set of inflectional affix slots which can appear in any inflectional affix template for this category.
An inflectional affix slot which can appear in at least one inflectional affix template for this category.
A short name for this inflectional affix slot.
A fuller description for this inflectional affix slot.
Check the box if this inflectional affix slot is optional in all of the templates it appears in.
The set of inflectional affix templates which are required in order for a word of this category to be well-formed.
An inflectional affix template of this category.
A short name for this inflectional affix template.
A fuller descripton for this inflectional affix template.
A table representation of the inflectional affix template. Right-click in it to edit it.
A special note on how to edit the template table above.

Check the box if this template completes a well-formed word. Uncheck it if there must be some category-changing derivational affix that applies to the template (and possibly another template of the new category) to finish the word.
Information about any inflectional classes for this category. Inflection classes are sometimes referred to as conjugation or declension classes.
The set of inflection classes this category has.
An inflection class (sometimes called conjugation or declension classes).
A short name for this inflection class.
The abbreviation for this inflection class.
A fuller description for this inflection class.
The set of inflection classes which are specializations of this inflection class.

The Inflection Class to which newly coined lexemes are usually assigned, to which lexemes from other classes 'drift' in the process of historical change, and the class to which children tend to assign lexemes before they learn the correct class.
Click here to select the default inflection class.
Categories which are subclasses of this category.
A category which is a subtype of the main category. (These are also listed in the Record List view.)
What the category of the left-hand member of the compound must be.
What the category of the right-hand member of the compound must be.
The category of this part of the compound.
Click here to select the category of this part of the compound.
The inflection class of this part of the compound.
Click here to select the inflection class of this part of the compound.
Any phonemes that are inserted between the two parts of the compound. These phonemes do not carry any meaning.
The phonemes of the linker.
Any environments which constrain when the linker may appear.
Click here to select any environments which constrain when the linker may appear.
A short name for this headed compound.
A fuller description of this headed compound.

Check the box if the right member of the compound is the "head" of the compound; that is, if the resulting stem has the category, etc. of the right member. If the box is not checked, the left member will be used as the "head."
A short name for this non-headed compound.
A fuller description of this non-headed compound.
The category, etc. that the resulting stem of the compound is.
A short name for this phoneme.
A fuller description of this phoneme.
The set of ways this phoneme surfaces.
One way this phoneme surfaces.
A short name for this natural class.
A fuller description of this natural class.
The abbreviation for this natural class.
The set of segments which belong to this natural class.
Click here to select a segment which belongs to this natural class.
A short name for this phonological environment.
A fuller description of this phonological environment.
The representation for this environment. See the help file for more information. [For now: Please see section 3.1.3 of the Conceptual Introduction document for how to key an environment.]
A special note on where to get information on how to key an environment.
The primary allomorph that the constraint is about.
Click here to select the primary allomorph that the constraint is about.
Click on the button to select the relative position of the other allomorph(s) with respect to the key allomorph.
The other allomorph(s) which cannot occur with the key allomorph.
Click here to select the other allomorph(s) which cannot occur with the key allomorph.
The primary morpheme that the constraint is about.
Click here to select the primary morpheme that the constraint is about.
Click on the button to select the relative position of the other morpheme(s) with respect to the key morpheme.
The other morpheme(s) which cannot occur with the key morpheme.
Click here to select the other morpheme(s) which cannot occur with the key morpheme.
A short name for this group of ad hoc rules.
A fuller description for this group of ad hoc rules; e.g. explaining what they have in common.
The set of ad hoc rules belonging to this group.
A rule which prevents allomorphs from co-occurring that is in this group of ad hoc rules.
A rule which prevents morphemes from co-occurring that is in this group of ad hoc rules.
The form which introduces an entry in a printed dictionary. It is the form by which a dictionary is sorted.
Information about the form(s) of the entry.
The base or underlying form of the lexical entry.
This shows all of the allomorphs of this entry.
An allomorph of the affix.
An allomorph of the stem or root.
The environments in which this allomorph occurs. Testers: Please see section 3.1.3 of the Conceptual Introduction document for how to key an environment.
Click here to select from phonetic environments you have used in the past.
The type of morpheme this is: root, prefix, suffix, etc.
Click here to select from a list of morpheme types.
This allomorph can attach to stems whose inflection classes are listed here.
Click here to select from a list of inflection classes.

The environments describing where the infix may occur with respect to the stem. Testers: Please see section 3.3 of the Conceptual Introduction document for how to key an infix position environment. (A review of section 3.1.3 might also prove helpful.)
Groups the possible functions of the lexical entry.
Information about the function(s) of the entry (how it can be used).
Information about this entry when it functions as a stem or root.
The category of this stem or root.
Click here to select the category of this stem or root.
The inflection (conjugation or declension) class of this stem or root. Leave it blank if the inflection class does not matter for this stem or root.
Click here to select the inflection (conjugation or declension) class of this stem or root.
Information about this affix when it functions as a derivational affix.
The category of the stem to which this affix attaches.
Click here to select the category of the stem to which this affix attaches.
The inflection (conjugation or declension) class which the stem to which this affix attaches must belong. Leave it blank if the inflection class does not matter for this affix.
Click here to select the inflection (conjugation or declension) class which the stem to which this affix attaches must belong.
The category of the stem resulting from the attachment of this affix.
Click here to select the category of the stem resulting from the attachment of this affix.
The inflection (conjugation or declension) class of the stem resulting from the attachment of this affix. Leave it blank if the inflection class does not matter for this affix.
Click here to select the inflection (conjugation or declension) class of the stem which results after this affix attaches.
Information about this affix when it functions as an inflectional affix.
This is the label or "category" this affix had when the lexical item was imported from some other lexicon (such as ShoeBox or ToolBox or LinguaLinks).
An inflectional affix slot to which this affix belongs. It can also refer to a category, if you do not yet know what slot the affix belongs in.
Click here to set the template slot (or category, if you don't know which slot yet).
Information about the meaning(s) of the entry.
One sense of this lexical entry.
The gloss for this sense to use in interlinearization.
The definition for this sense.
The way this sense functions.
Click here to select the way this sense functions.
Vernacular example sentences for this entry.
A vernacular example sentence for this entry.
Translations of the vernacular example sentence.
A translation of the vernacular example sentence.
Other senses which are related to this sense of the entry.
This is the date on which this item was first created.
This is the date on which this item was last modified.
